taskbody.context:
Dairy- free coconut ice cream with pineapple chunks
Duration: 1 hour
Yields: 1 quart
Tools:
Large mixing bowl
Whisk
Rubber spatula
Liquid measuring cup
Measuring spoons
Ingredients:
1 cup of coconut milk
3 cups of coconut cream
Â½ cup of sugar
1 cup of frozen pineapple chunks
Combine coconut milk, sugar, and coconut cream in large mixing bowl. Whisk to combine.
Take the freezer bowl out of the freezer and insert it into the base.
Take the mixing arm and place it into the base, with the circle side up, the arm will feel like it is loosely fitting.
Place the lid on top of the base; turn clockwise to lock the lid into place.
Plug in the unit once the bowl, arm, and lid are in place. Hit the 'Ice Cream' button and select 'Start'.
Once the freezer bowl has begun spinning, pour in your mixed ingredients.
Once your ingredients are all in, place the measuring cup on top of the lid.
The mixture will take about 15-40 minutes to process, depending on how much you are making, the maximum amount is 2 quarts.
When the mixture is at your desired thickness, you can turn off the machine and transfer it to a bowl or an airtight container to be frozen.
NOTE: If you are adding any mix-ins to your ice cream, remove cap and pour in 10 minutes just as ice cream is starting to firm.
Add in pineapple as mix ins, just as ice cream is thickening.
